benchmark_details.name: SOCIAL EVAL
benchmark_details.overview: SOCIAL EVAL is a script-based bilingual benchmark designed to evaluate and inspect large language models' social intelligence (SI) through outcome-oriented goal achievement evaluation and process-oriented interpersonal ability evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To thoroughly evaluate and inspect LLMs’ social intelligence via a comprehensive social world construction and to identify discrepancies between LLMs and humans in social interactions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The scale of SOCIAL EVAL is currently limited due to the manual construction process, involving 153 world trees for evaluation, which might not provide a comprehensive analysis of all interpersonal abilities.

data.source: Manually crafted narrative scripts incorporating social interactions and outcomes tailored toward evaluating social intelligence.
data.annotation: Manually crafted by experts in social psychology and narrative structure.

methodology.calculation: Metrics measure LLMs’ ability to achieve social goals and use appropriate interpersonal abilities in scripted scenarios.
methodology.interpretation: Results provide comparative insights between human and LLM performance in navigating social interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: Human baselines established using graduate-level participants for evaluating performance on SI tasks.
methodology.validation: Through rigorous script crafting and iterative quality checks among multiple annotators.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected does not contain any personally identifiable information, and all contributors are compensated fairly.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: A consent form was obtained from all human participants involved in the creation of the benchmark and evaluations.
